Title: Sr Sys/Test Validation Engineer - 122961 - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
What you do at AMD changes everything
At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.
Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.
Sr Sys/Test Validation Engineer - 122961
The Role:
With AMD's Client engineering teams, you will be exposed to the world’s best Desktop/PC and Mobile CPU, GPU and APU processors for accelerated system computing power. As an AMD Client Engineer you will have visibility to cutting edge multi-layered security features, H-Series processors optimized for gamers and creators, and U-Series processors optimized for thin and light notebooks. Come join our world class client engineering team providing rapid career growth advancement, and access to cutting edge technologies, through its year over year record-breaking market share, product performance and revenue gains!
Come join the team responsible for driving AMD’s Shift-Left strategies, planning and execution of our Client Compute Products, which are used by major OEM and compute solution customers in the world. In this role, you get to interact with multiple partners (PHY, firmware/BIOS, SW, IP, SOC DV, SOC and system architects) to plan, build, execute, and debug system use cases, in addition to advancing pre-silicon and post-silicon infrastructure to expand validation capabilities.
The Person:
AMD is seeking a senior Sys/Test validation engineer who is self-motivated and who thrives in an environment that requires creative debugging skills, seek to improve pre-silicon and post-silicon system validation coverage capabilities, and a passion for improving our overall Shift-Left strategies and goals.
Key Responsibilities:
Verify and validate hardware products designed and developed in house at AMD using the standard qualification process developed within the electrical I/O interface compliance group and participates in creating/improving all phases of test procedures and methodologies.
Participate in defining/improving/implementing test plans/procedures.
Analyze the failures found in testing and support the internal design team to find the root cause of the issues.
Characterize and validate various I/O interface on compliance using various high speed capturing equipment and devices.
Connect with various internal departments to resolve anomalies
Participate in issuing internal/external releasable test reports.
Perform the Software and Hardware level test using external and internal AMD test tools, including oscilloscope, analyzer, margin test tools, functional test, etc.
Preferred Experience:
Experience in video/graphics/computing product development and sustaining, system level hardware and software design
Background in IC technology
Familiarity with Linux is an asset.
Proficient in using all MS operating systems and the configuration/setting of PCs.
Good written and oral communication skills
Self-motivated and able to work independently and reliably to meet time requirements
Academic Credentials:
Bachelors /Masters of Science in Electrical/Computer Engineering with relevant experience

Markham, ON

Title: Développeur Logiciel (Java / MATLAB) / Software developer (Java / MATLAB) - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com

OPAL-RT Technologies recherche un Développeur Logiciel (Java / MATLAB)
À propos d’OPAL-RT Technologies
Imaginez travailler pour une entreprise qui compte parmi ses clients la NASA, Bombardier, ABB, EMBRAER, MIT, GE, Ford, GM, NREL et Hydro-Québec! OPAL-RT s’est donné comme ambitieux défi de démocratiser la simulation temps réel afin de la rendre accessible à chaque ingénieur et chercheur. En rejoignant le clan des OPALIENS, vous contribuerez à la technologie du futur.
Leader mondial dans la diversité des applications, nos outils sont utilisés dans une multitude de secteurs tels que l'automobile, l'aérospatiale, l’énergie, le transport, la fabrication industrielle, etc. Fondée au Québec et maintenant assurée par une présence mondiale, OPAL-RT a le vent dans les voiles!

Les produits eFPGASIM et eHS (Electrical Hardware Solver) témoignent de notre avancement technologique dans ce domaine. Le candidat sélectionné devra suivre les développements technologiques des outils de simulation en électronique de puissance et connaître les bases du fonctionnement du produit ainsi que son rôle dans un environnement de simulation en temps réel.

JAVA, MATLAB/Simulink, Git (ou outil équivalent). Intérêt pour la modélisation et le contrôle de système d’électronique de puissance;
Autres compétences (atouts) :
C++, Python, SQL, Technologie FPGA, Jenkins, Jira/Confluence, JavaScript, Workflow Agile, connaissances en électronique de puissance.
Connaissances linguistiques :
Bonne maîtrise de l’anglais ou du français (la maîtrise des deux langues est un atout).
Compétences recherchées :
Autonomie, polyvalence, proactivité, curiosité, organisation, bonne communication, esprit d’équipe, rigueur et détermination, capacité d’analyse et d’adaptation.
Une carrière chez OPAL-RT vous conviendra si :
Vous recherchez des défis stimulants qui vous pousseront à vous dépasser sans cesse.
Vous rêvez d’une ambiance à la fois familiale, professionnelle, collaborative et conviviale.
Vous avez besoin d’un horaire flexible et l’accès au télétravail afin de concilier votre vie privée à votre vie professionnelle.
Vous souhaitez parfaire vos connaissances et votre savoir-faire en côtoyant des chercheurs, des innovateurs, des scientifiques qui ont tous un point en commun, la
Passion
.

Vous désirez être considéré pour vos idées, votre créativité et vos talents.
Vous connaissez votre valeur et recherchez une rémunération globale concurrentielle.

Title: Sr Software Engineer/Developer - Hardware Emulation - Brampton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About MDA
For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.
Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and Geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.
We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.
Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!
The Position
We’re on the hunt for a
Senior Software Engineer/Developer
with
hardware emulation expertise
on our Robotics & Space Operations team at our Brampton office.
With 40 years of operational experience and proven performance on the iconic Canadarm programs including Space Shuttle and International Space Station robotics and operations support, our Robotics & Space Operations team has 100% mission success in making space dreams come true.
As our Senior Software Engineer/Developer, you will contribute as part of a team to the design, implementation, maintenance, and testing of software solutions that are modular, extendable, testable, and efficient. You will benefit the team with your hardware emulation experience by designing and leading the implementation of software emulation of flight hardware to enable early development, rapid and frequent automated testing, and fault injection without specialized test hardware. You will work on teams that develop flight software for control of robotic arms, rovers, and other robotics in space.
Responsibilities:
As part of a team:
Lead design of solutions to emulate hardware in software
Lead implementation of solutions to emulate hardware in software
Lead designs for safety critical, real-time software solutions
Mentor and grow the skills of team members via conversations, review of work products, explanation of tradeoffs, etc.
Support estimation efforts for new tasks
Provide feedback and suggestions to improve standards, tools, processes, etc.
Other duties as will be assigned from time to time by management or a team lead
Required Skills/Experience
Proven ability to create embedded hardware emulators
Strong written/verbal communication skills
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong programming knowledge
C/C++
RTOS or bare metal
Bachelor degree in Software, Computer, or Electrical Engineering or Computer Science
5+ years of relevant experience
Highly motivated, enthusiastic, and a positive thinker
Beneficial Skills/Experience
Hardware emulation tools (e.g. QEMU, Simics, OVPSim, etc.)
Embedded device experience (ARM, PowerPC)
Agile development environment
Automated testing
Test driven development (TDD, ATDD, BDD)
Continuous integration/build automation
Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.
We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.
We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.
MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.
MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.
COVID-19 Hiring Update: Strengthening our workforce is more important than ever to meet our customers’ mission-critical needs. We are continuing to hire many talented people, and we are closely monitoring COVID-19 to ensure safe hiring practices are used. This includes limiting onsite candidate interviews and prioritizing video interviews.
With a priority on maintaining the safety of our employees, customers and communities, MDA has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for employees and visitors. Please speak to a recruiter for more details.

Title: ASIC IP Verification Engineer - 76311 - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
What you do at AMD changes everything
At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.
Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.
ASIC IP Verification Engineer
THE ROLE:
The role owns the functional verification tests used for AMD’s graphics processor during manufacturing. This key role produces a large financial return to AMD by ensuring that we only package good silicon die. We need a self-driven creative engineer who can craft new tests to verify the operation of our new features and product configurations.
THE PERSON:
An analytical thinker with problem-solving skills and excellent attention to detail
Possesses excellent comprehension, communication, and interpersonal skills
Enjoys working in a fast-paced, multi-project team environment using state of the art tools and technology
Must be a self-starter, and able to work independently to complete tasks on schedule
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Collaborate with architects, hardware and verification engineers, and product planners to understand the new features and configurations
Create the new tests required to verify our new products
Debug test failures to determine the root cause; work with RTL and firmware engineers to resolve design defects and correct any test issues
Expand the capability of the tests to enable them to be used for timing and power characterization
Identify and implement opportunities for improving AMD’s ASIC verification methodology
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
Proficient in creating IP level or SOC level ASIC verification tests
Proficient in debugging RTL code using simulation tools
Experienced with Assembly code, Verilog, System Verilog, C, and C++
Graphics pipeline knowledge
ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
BS degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering
MS degree preferred
LOCATION:
This position can be located in Orlando, FL or Markham, Ontario, Canada

Title: IT Support Analyst - Oakville, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
BWXT Precision Manufacturing Inc. is a subsidiary of BWXT Canada Ltd. BWXT Precision Manufacturing Inc. is a leading supplier of precision-machined components to the international nuclear industry. We specialize in the manufacture of fuel channel and feeder components, tooling and fuelling machine spares.
We are searching for a talented and qualified
IT Support Analyst
for our facility in
Oakville, Ontario.
JOB SUMMARY
To support and maintain in-house technology equipment and IT assets. This includes installing, configuring, diagnosing, repairing, and upgrading all corporate hardware and software while ensuring its optimal performance. This role includes entry-level data-network support duties to maintain the stable operation of the in-house computer network.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and maintain basic and specialized images for end-user desktop and laptop systems.
Implement, document, and support the desktop/laptop/server image deployment servers.
Diagnose, resolve, and document hardware and software network problems in a timely and accurate fashion.
Develop packages and solutions to assist the users in the performance of their tasks.
Installing, configuring, maintaining, and optimizing all network hardware, software, and communication links while ensuring minimal network downtime.
Build, troubleshoot, and repair hardware (printers, desktops/laptops, scanners, projectors, etc.).
Use deployment tools to create, test, deploy and maintain desktop images.
Troubleshoot problem areas in a timely and accurate fashion.
Provide end-user training and assistance where required.
Manage inventory of current computer systems, parts, and software.
Participate in implementing system security patches and software/firmware/system upgrades.
Decommissioning of systems in an approved and secure fashion.
Assist users with remote access systems issues.
Advanced troubleshooting and user desk-side support.
Basic networking support.
First-level support for configuring, diagnosing, repairing, cell phones and laptop broadband support and services.
Remain current on trends in the IT industry regarding end-user systems and support techniques.
Assist IT System Engineers with administration and support of data center infrastructure operations.
Be available after normal working hours to handle critical issues.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in IT related discipline, or equivalent experience preferred.
Minimum 2 years of experience.
In-depth knowledge of Microsoft desktop operating systems (present and near future).
In-depth knowledge of office automation software used at the facility, such as Microsoft Office.
Ability to solve practical problems and carry out responsibilities under general supervision.
Ability to organize workload for effective implementation.
Strong customer skills.
Ability to function as an effective team member.
Ability to adapt as the external environment and organization evolves.

Title: Senior Network Specialist - Smarthome Security & Automation Team - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Location:
Mississauga, ON, CA Montreal, Quebec, CA
Req ID: 15401
Jobs by Category: Technology Solutions
Job Function: Technology
Status: Full Time
Schedule: Regular
Join our team
TELUS has become the #1 market leader in the Smarthome Security & Automation industry in Canada—transforming the way we make our customers’ homes and businesses safer and bring convenience and peace of mind to their lives. By using our premier networks, technology, and services, TELUS is bringing the power of Smart Home Security & Automation solutions to life for our residential and business customers in new ways with creative products and service offerings.
The Smarthome Security & Automation (SSA) DevOps Team oversees the development and support of technologies that drive an exceptional customer experience across consumer, business and health portfolios. Our team works with internal and external partners to develop new products and services and provides the highest tier of support for security and automation products at TELUS. We spearhead complex root cause analysis investigations and drive reliability improvements through technology innovations. Your expertise and passion will help us ensure that TELUS customers receive the best technology solution and services in the world!
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
As a Senior Network Specialist, you will be part of a team that support the Smarthome Security & Automation network and infrastructure. Your passion and subject matter expertise will help us sustain and evolve our best in class network.
Your responsibilities will include scaling support of several data centers and be responsible for day to day assistance with network and capacity management. You will work closely with both internal customers and external vendors to facilitate smooth operations and delivery of new technologies and solutions.
In addition, you have excellent network implementation and troubleshooting skills combined with a proven documentation methodology. You are a team player with strong written and verbal communication skills and an ability to interact effectively with peers. The desire and ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment is essential.
Here's how
Working with a national team of highly skilled Network Engineers and DevOps Engineers to:
Logical configure IP Core Network Devices, including: Juniper, Palo Alto, and Cisco routers/switches/firewalls
Complete logical migrations, capacity augmentation and operating system upgrades on IP Core Network devices
Develop fully automated network deployments leveraging CICD Pipeline and TELUS's Automation Framework
Leverage your Dev-Ops skills to help strengthen Dev-Ops practice within TELUS Smart Security & Automation
Help develop network and infrastructure roadmap for SmartHome Security & Automation.
Voici vos futures responsabilités
Vous travaillerez avec une équipe nationale composée d’ingénieurs de réseau et d’ingénieurs de développement et d’exploitation hautement qualifiés pour faire ce qui suit :
Assurer la configuration logique des appareils du réseau central IP (p. ex. routeurs et commutateurs Juniper, Palo Alto et Cisco, coupe-feu)
Effectuer des migrations logiques, des augmentations de capacité et des mises à niveau de système d’exploitation sur des dispositifs de réseau central IP
Exécuter des déploiements réseau entièrement automatisés au moyen du pipeline d’intégration et de déploiement continus (CICD) ou du cadre d’automatisation de TELUS
Mettre à profit vos compétences pour améliorer les activités de développement et exploitation au sein de l’équipe Maison connectée et automatisation de TELUS
Contribuer au développement de la feuille de route du réseau et de l’infrastructure pour Maison connectée et automatisation
You're the missing piece of the puzzle
5+ of years of experience as a Network Engineer, preferably in a DevOps environment
Strong knowledge of IP Core protocols used in Service Provider networks: OSPF, BGP, MPLS, ISIS, STP, etc
Experience with the following hardware:
JUNIPER: EX, MX, QFX series
Palo Alto 3020 and 3050 series
CISCO: ASR9k, NCS 5500, ME3400 series
Highly autonomous, extremely detail oriented, and has significant experience of supporting large scale, enterprise class networks.
In-Depth experience with managing network impacting outages, coordinating troubleshooting sessions, and working with vendors for swift resolutions
Creative thinker with a passion for user experience
Ownership mindset with result driven passion
Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
CCNP Certification or equivalent
Willingness to work in an on-call (day/night) rotation
Great-to-haves
Ability to program in Python and understanding of data models such as YANG / JSON / YAML
Knowledge or experience with version control systems: Git / Gitlab / Github
